quizone.hint_j: Do or do not, there is no try. --Master Yoda

answers_j.a: True
answers_j.b: False
answers_j.c: A value of True or False, but never both.
answers_j.d: Something you add to soup.

quizone.question_j: What makes a parameter different from an argument?
quizone.hint_j: I got the dog a bed, but the cat took it over.

answers_j.a: A parameter keeps the chickens from escaping. Arguements make them angry.
answers_j.b: The context. A parameter is a placeholder, the argument is the thing that occupies that place.
answers_j.c: They are exactly the same.
answers_j.d: about 5 kilos give or take.

quizone.question_j: An algorithm is which of these things:
quizone.hint_j: A process or set of rules to be followed in obtaining some result.

answers_j.a: A chicken and dumplings recipe.
answers_j.b: The instructions for hooking up my computer moniter.
answers_j.c: a formula for determining the nth fibonacci number.
answers_j.d: All of the above.

quizone.question_j: Modern computers use electrical signals in the hardware to store and transmit data.
quizone.hint_j: I turned the light switch to on, and light appeared.

answers_j.T: True, although there is space to argue magnetism is the true hero of modern data storage.
answers_j.F: False, this is the Matrix, binary data is stored in humans living in pods of fluid goo.

quizone.question_j: A files 'extension' is the type of file the computer reads it as.  A .txt file is also known as:

answers_j.a: a text file
answers_j.b: plain text file
answers_j.c: a file formatted as a sequence of lines of electronic text.
answers_j.d: all of the above.  wink wink, nudge nudge.

quizone.question_j: A method is a procedure used in a particular manner to interpret and use data
quizone.hint_j: Her method of straining the noodles, had four steps.

answers_j.T: True, some methods are simple recipes, some are highly complex data manipulation.
answers_j.F: False, Logically if she weighs the same as a duck, she's made of wood!

quizone.question_j: How would you describe a recursive function?
quizone.hint_j: I will not stop until every apple has been plucked from this tree.

answers_j.a: a function that calls another function
answers_j.b: a function that breaks your app, computer and sometimes the wifi
answers_j.c: a function that calls itself until a base case is met
answers_j.d: a function that loops all day everyday

quizone.question_j: Regular expressions help us do what?
quizone.hint_j: I thought his name started with a B... Barnaby? Bob? Barkley?

answers_j.a: alleviate stress through verbalizing emotions with code
answers_j.b: match combinations of characters in string values
answers_j.c: add description to code directly in the code without interfering
answers_j.d: join together multiple arrays into one

quizone.question_j: The zero, in binary is a -low volatage signal, while the one is high-volatage (5 volts).
quizone.hint_j: Electricity has no voltage if a circuit is off, and voltage if a circuit is on.

answers_j.T: True, just like an on/off signal,  this is why 0 is commonly a representation of False/null/None.

quizone.question_j: This is some JavaScript code. var means variable.  What is the variable catsName value?
quizone.hint_j: She is a pretty kitty, decendant of the mountain beasts of yore.

answers_j.a: 'Sage'
answers_j.b: Here's the bit I look up some crazy binary code for the characters in Sage.
answers_j.c: Or I could look up how many integers the memory would assign to that pointer.
answers_j.d: Anyone got some catnip?

quiztwo.question_j: What is a string type in computers?
quiztwo.hint_j: I wrote a letter, but it only has one.

answers_j.a: something that ties a sequence of items together
answers_j.b: A sentence, a character, a word, usually denoted by the single or double quotes. Unicode and ASCII are examples of character encoding.
answers_j.c: Where particles are linked through the quantum gravity of one dimensional objects.
answers_j.d: The stuff in a can your parent never let you buy from the dollar store.

quiztwo.question_j: A string is stored in a computer as an array, (sequence of characters in byte code).
quiztwo.hint_j: An array is just a term for data that is held in sequence/arrangement in memory.

answers_j.T: While the exact data structure may be different on a given machine, it is an array type structure.
answers_j.F: If a string is stored as an array, how come my spell check always wants to correct it to -duck-?

quiztwo.question_j: You can store characters, numbers, symbols in a string and a string can even be empty.
quiztwo.hint_j: When they have you make complex passwords, eyeH8allth3s3Pa55w0rds, it is stored as a string.

answers_j.T: True, an empty string is stored basically as a string of length 0.
answers_j.F: False, three inch strings for: Tying up very small parcels, attatching notes to pigeons' legs, uh, destroying household pests...

quiztwo.question_j: Why are the quotation marks so important to coding languages? (code: Python)
quiztwo.hint_j: If typo's were bugs, I must have killed a million by now.

answers_j.a: Quotes make recognizing strings and characters in code easier for the computer and the coder.
answers_j.b: I'm so sorry to anyone who can't eat a reeses peanut butter cup.
answers_j.c: If you're ever a ghost you have my full permission to posess me to eat a peanut butter cup.
answers_j.d: Why are there always empty Reese's packages by my bed when I wake up?

quiztwo.question_j: An integer can be stored in a string, and you CAN perform math on it.
quiztwo.hint_j: string and integer are two very different things in computer processing.

answers_j.T: True, one plus two equals five yes?
answers_j.F: False, math can be performed on many integer types, but a string is not one of those.

quiztwo.question_j: Character encoding can do many things, What will the returned string (x) be in this code?(Python)
quiztwo.code_box_j:
def encode_it(a_string):
    #reverse the string
    new = a_string[::-1]
    return new
x = encode_it('password')
quiztwo.hint_j: What the [::-1] does is make a new string starting from the last item, stepping through (right to left) to the first.

answers_j.a: Dubstep
answers_j.b: Drow fra Bisina.
answers_j.c: drowssap
answers_j.d: #seeItatTheSeaShore

quiztwo.question_j: Which of these strings will print without error?(Python)
quiztwo.code_box_j:
One_String = 'this is a single quote.'
Two_String = "this is a double quote."
Three_String = "this is a mixed 'quotes'." 
Four_String = 'this is also a mixed "quotes".' 
Five_String = 'this string needs an "\ escape quote.' 
Six_String = " so does "\this"\ one."
quiztwo.hint_j: These all printed in a python print statement. There are no trick questions. Only hints to point you at the right answers.

answers_j.a: All of them.
answers_j.b: Six_String and Five_String
answers_j.c: a
answers_j.d: None of these are strings.

quiztwo.question_j: Why is it important for an html file to have this bit of code? (language varies.)
quiztwo.hint_j: It is said when people become used to their screen reader, they can go 300+ words per minute.

answers_j.a: So hackers know how to taunt you in French.
answers_j.b: Both c  and  d.  <--------
answers_j.c: This assists browsers and search engines in finding appropriate results.
answers_j.d: Screen readers use this as an indicator on which language to read the text on your page in.

quizthree.question_j: An example of how a off by one error can occur is:
quizthree.hint_j: We start with 0, and add to that. So zero is often thought of as a starting point.

answers_j.a: On the count of 3
answers_j.b: So, after you say the word two... or after you say the word three?
answers_j.c: Lets just not count.
answers_j.d: The list/array has 10 items in it, so I try to loop through index 1 - 10.

quizthree.question_j: A low level computer language simplified definition:
quizthree.hint_j: Many high-level languages use abstraction, are very human readable, but require being compiled/translated to a lower-level language.

answers_j.a: A language very close to machine. This kind of code is used by the machine for very specific and declared purposes set by the user written code.
answers_j.b: I told Hal to open the pod bay doors, but it refused.
answers_j.c: Python like other high-level languages rely on a compiler to translate the code into something the machine can understand.
answers_j.d: Within the code written by the user are many hidden processes the computer must translate without the coder's knowledge.

quizthree.question_j: An if statement checks whether a given variable of some type, is existent, True, of some specified value.

answers_j.T: True, and it can also verify if something is NOT true, NOT equal to, or NOT existent (null-None), and many more.
answers_j.F: False, An if statement only qualifies wether an argument is plausible and deniable.

quizthree.question_j: What do you think this code (JavaScript) does?
quizthree.hint_j: there is chocolate in this room, and I shall EAT IT.

answers_j.a: Makes me happy.
answers_j.b: Defends against the Dementor's sadness.
answers_j.c: if chocolate exists, is true, and is not 0/null/none, then perform eat on chocolate.

quizthree.question_j: What decade was the world wide web technology being produced by Tim Berners-Lee?
quizthree.hint_j: Decade of:  The Goonies, E.T., Gremlins, Aliens, The Princess Bride....

answers_j.d: Where we're going, we don't need roads.

quizthree.question_j: Turing Complete is a term coined after the father of Computer Science.
quizthree.hint_j: He invented a machine called 'Enigma' that helped stop World War 2, how cool is that?

answers_j.T: True, his concepts of Algorithms and Computation are a driving force in CS to this day.

quizthree.question_j: Why do we call the main circuit board of a computer the 'Motherboard'?
quizthree.hint_j: Like a mother, it is the main hub for distribution and 'where did I put that thing mom?'.

answers_j.a: They needed a different term than 'mainboard', mainboards were not extensible.
answers_j.b: Because daughterboards are extensions plugged into it to add more circuits/processing.
answers_j.c: It is the main ciruit board for processing signals.
answers_j.d: All of the above.

quizthree.question_j: Forms take user data and send it to a web server.  This is commonly called a POST request.  How does the data get delivered?
quizthree.hint_j: What would you request sun screen for?.

answers_j.a: The data gets transferred via third party JavaScript libraries
answers_j.b: The data is sent through an HTTP request and included in the request body aka payload.
answers_j.c: Mozilla runs the interweb.
answers_j.d: The data is saved to the header of a response.

quizthree.question_j: Status codes summarize the outcome of an http request.  Which of the following is not true about them?

answers_j.a: They signal if an http request was processed successfully
answers_j.b: 404 reveals the server did not locate a matching resource.
answers_j.c: 908 tells us to keep waiting.
answers_j.d: 5 prefixes a server error.

quizthree.question_j: MIME types exist in the HTTP world.  Which of the following best describes MIME types?

answers_j.a: They are event handlers within event handlers
answers_j.b: They are set in the Content-Type response header and tells the client how to parse an HTML response body.
answers_j.c: They are tags used to prevent screen readers from reading element contents out loud
answers_j.d: It prints your html code via the nearest printer.

quizfour.hint_j: This type of memory needs power to store data. It is temporary.

answers_j.a: Random Access Memory. With this, you can work on your word document, but if you turn off your computer without 'saving', the work is lost.
answers_j.b: Dodge?
answers_j.c: Readily Avaliable Microprocesses,  Kind of...  Don't pick this one.
answers_j.d: Where permenant data is stored in the Motherboard. --not this one either.

quizfour.hint_j: It's almost literal, data is linked.

answers_j.a: The grocery list, but you can't get to the next item you need until the first one is in the cart.
answers_j.b: Start -->  middle ---> End
answers_j.c: Pieces of data that are joined by their reference(pointer) to the next or previous piece of data. (Sometimes both.)
answers_j.d: Sounds like something for a tech interview.

quizfour.question_j: A Queue is First in - First out, while a Stack is Last-in - First-out
quizfour.hint_j: Standing in line at the bank, is a Queue. Going through a pile of books, by grabbing the top one is a stack.

answers_j.T: True, Sometimes keeping data in these kinds of structures is for the specific order involved in either one.
answers_j.F: False, I can't think of any way to joke about Queue's and Stacks.

quizfour.question_j: An array is a data structure that uses keys or indexes, to place in memory a given value. Choose the answers that are true about arrays.

answers_j.a: John von Neumann wrote the first array-sorting program (merge sort) in 1945
answers_j.b: Instead of having pointers like a linked list, the array uses math to determine where an array item is in memory.
answers_j.c: The memory address of the first element of an array is called first address, foundation address, or base address.
answers_j.d: All of the above.  Thanks Wikipedia.
